name: test_allgrain

steps.name: Protein Rest
steps.description: Used for some authentic German styles.  Attempt to draw decoction from the thickest portion of the mash.  Profiles vary.  Some traditional German mashes use a long acid rest at 40 deg C.  Also some sources recommend the decoction amount be given a 15 minute saccharification rest at 158 F (70 C) before boiling it.

steps.name: Saccharification
steps.description: Used for some authentic German styles.  Attempt to draw decoction from the thickest portion of the mash.  Profiles vary.  Some traditional German mashes use a long acid rest at 40 deg C.  Also some sources recommend the decoction amount be given a 15 minute saccharification rest at 158 F (70 C) before boiling it.

steps.name: Mash Out
steps.description: Used for some authentic German styles.  Attempt to draw decoction from the thickest portion of the mash.  Profiles vary.  Some traditional German mashes use a long acid rest at 40 deg C.  Also some sources recommend the decoction amount be given a 15 minute saccharification rest at 158 F (70 C) before boiling it.

steps.name: Lauter
steps.description: Used for some authentic German styles.  Attempt to draw decoction from the thickest portion of the mash.  Profiles vary.  Some traditional German mashes use a long acid rest at 40 deg C.  Also some sources recommend the decoction amount be given a 15 minute saccharification rest at 158 F (70 C) before boiling it.

steps.name: Package
steps.description: Package the beer for aging and consumption
